addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my singular good Lord the L. Burghley, Lord highe Treasuro
r
of England.

Marche 1589
From M
r
Thomas Bodley to
e L Th
re
r

page.lettertext:
fol.249r
It may please yo
r
L. to be advertised
at
the Enemie hath taken of Late
e castell of
Sevenberghen
by
Breda
, which abidde the
shotte of
e Cannon, but yelded in
e end to
the mercy of
e Enemie: who caused some fewe
to be executed,
at were of those in
e boate
that surprised Breda, and di[m]issed e rest.
He hath also skirmished w
t
certain
companies,
at issued out of Breda, but left
behinde, besides those
at were slaine, w
ch
were
not many, threescore prisoners. It is
thought
at
e Enemie will build a sconce at
Heyde
, a village adjoining to Breda, thereby
purposing to stoppe
e passage of
e river, w
ch
we shall hardly impeache for want of forces.
S
r
Francis Vere
is nowe at
Disbourgh
,
but those companies w
ch
were w
t
him at Breda,
remaine at
Williamstat
: from whens they can
not be spared, till
e Enemies forces be reti-
red. Heere are divers Deputes
come from
Utrecht
, to present
e government
of
at Province to
Count Maurice
, w
ch
is all
done, after
e Example of
Overissell
, w
t
out
e
knowledge or privitie of
e
Councell of state
.
of
e
Frenche kinges
late victorie,
heere is nothing yet knowen in particular,
nor directly, but
at whiche we have from the
Enemie. The opinion of it is great, for di-
vers circumstances, especially for
at there is
one come hither from
Cambray
, who declareth
that he was at
Valencienne
in
Hennault
, in
the company of the Popes Nuntio, and
e Em-
bassado
r
Mendosa
, being newly fledde out
of
Paris
. By letters of the Enemie
fol.249v
whiche are heere intercepted, it is signified
that
e Bishop of
Liege
hath sent his Embassa-
do
rs
to
Collen
, to require
e kay of one of
their gates,
e possession of certaine milles upon
e Rhine, and
e ancient jurisdiction of the
Count of Newenar
, w
ch
if they doe refuse, it is
denounced unto them,
at the Bishop will in-
treat them as Enemies. This message, as it
should seeme, hath put
e Citie in a very great
trouble, w
ch
is wholy purposed to withstand
his demaundes. Moreover among those
letters, there is an Italian, as it should appeere
by conjecture, of
e Bishops familie, who writeth
to a frinde,
at
e Popes Nuntio residing in
that place had letters from
Rome
,
che il Pa-
pa fa un Concilio Lateranese, per l'asso-
lutione di sua Maestade: che se e' vero, co-
me qua si crede, e un gran punto per il
Re Francia
. Because we can not heere ima-
gin w
ch
Ma
tie
is meant, nor w
at
Absolution, I
have written
e wordes, as they lie in
e letter,
leaving
e construction to yo
r
L. conjecture.
Bothe this letter and
e rest beare date the
15 of Marche. Heere is a
generall bruit at this present, that
Count
William
in
Frise
hath surprised
Delfesill
,
the chiefest part of
Groninghen
. Howbeit as yet
there is no certaintie of it, other then by privat
mens letters, out of
Gelderland
. From
Frankford
heere are letters of
e 9 of Marche stylo
ve
t
that
e
Empero
r
doth Levie for
e
K. of Spaine
5000 Germans, under
e conduct of
e
Count
Hieronimo de Ladron
: whiche are to passe Muster
at
Cremona
, and
Cassal maggior
.
Having
fol.250r
nothing els to advertise, I take my humble
leave, beseeching yo
r
L. to acquaint
M
r
Secre-
t ary
w
t
as muche as I have written.
Fr
o
e
Hage
. Ma
r
23. 89
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
